title: Beautiful serif inspired on renaissance (?) writing
content:
Dear Typophiles,  
I’ve found this beautiful font on explanation texts in the museum of the Castle “Estense” in Ferrara Italy.  
I’d like to know if anyone recognises this font and how the style/influence could be classified.

Thanks in advance,  
Jan

Font: 

 DF Rialto (italic) 

Solved By: 

 [akira1975](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317082949/http:/typophile.com/user/4504 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [text.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317082949/http:/typophile.com/files/text_9.png) | 232.87 KB |
author: Synthview

comments.content:
I think it’s DF Rialto designed by Giovanni di Faccio and Lui Karner.  
 [http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-31465.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317082949/http:/luc.devroye.org/fonts-31465.html "http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-31465.html")  
 [http://kltf.de/kltf\_seen\_rialtodancing.shtml](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317082949/http:/kltf.de/kltf_seen_rialtodancing.shtml "http://kltf.de/kltf\_seen\_rialtodancing.shtml")
Love that capital 'B' Jan! Great find.
Oh, my ... that is incredibly beautiful ...

Thanks akira1975! It looks the one :)  
So the category would be humanist antiqua?
